About Me

Here's a bit about me.

I grew up in Baltimore, Maryland. Now, I am a senior at Tufts University, where I study computer science and philosophy. My advisors are Karen Edwards and Patrick Forber. After graduation, I will begin working at Goldman Sachs in NYC as an engineering analyst.

I have many academic interests. Within computer science, I am interested in software engineering, product design, and artificial intelligence; within philosophy, I am interested in moral philosophy and philosophy of mind. My senior thesis focuses on the implications of metaethics for the training of moral machines. I am the head of operations at JumboCode and the founder of Tufts Effective Altruism.

Outsider of the classroom, I row for Tufts, run long distances, attempt to be a vegetarian, meditate, write, and root for the Baltimore Ravens.
